data.enText: to wash sth with clean water only, not using soap

data.chText: 将做熟的面食在开水里过一下。
data.enText: Rinse the cooked pasta with boiling water.
to remove the soap from sth with clean water after washing it
to remove dirt, etc. from sth by washing it with clean water
She rinsed the mud from her hands.

data.chText: 我想漱漱口，去掉嘴里的味道。
data.enText: I wanted to rinse the taste out of my mouth.
rinse sth↔out
to make sth clean, especially a container, by washing it with water

data.chText: 使用前将杯子冲洗一下。
data.enText: Rinse the cup out before use.
an act of rinsing sth
I gave the glass a rinse.

data.chText: 在最后一遍漂洗时加入织物柔顺剂。
data.enText: Fabric conditioner is added during the final rinse.
a liquid that you put on your hair when it is wet in order to change its colour
a blue rinse
a liquid used for cleaning the mouth and teeth

data.text: clean ♦ wash ♦ rinse ♦ cleanse ♦ dry-clean ♦ bathe

data.chText: 以上各词均含打扫、洗净之义，尤指用水、肥皂等。
data.enText: These words all mean to remove dirt from sth, especially by using water and/or soap.
clean

data.chText: 指除去灰尘、打扫，尤指用水或化学品洗净、擦净：
data.enText: to remove dirt or dust from sth, especially by using water or chemicals

data.chText: 这栋别墅一周打扫两次。
data.enText: The villa is cleaned twice a week.
Have you cleaned your teeth?

data.chText: 这件大衣脏了，我得送去干洗。
data.enText: This coat is filthy. I'll have it cleaned (= dry-cleaned) .
wash
to remove dirt from sth using water and usually soap
He quickly washed his hands and face.
These jeans need washing.
rinse

data.chText: 指用清水冲洗、清洗、冲掉皂液：
data.enText: to remove dirt, etc. from sth using clean water only, not soap; to remove the soap from sth with clean water after washing it

data.chText: 将做熟的面食在开水里过一下。
data.enText: Rinse the cooked pasta with boiling water.

data.chText: 一定要把皂液冲洗干净。
data.enText: Make sure you rinse all the soap out.
cleanse
to clean your skin or a wound
dry-clean
to clean clothes using chemicals instead of water
bathe

data.chText: 指用水清洗（伤口或身体部位等）
data.enText: to wash sth with water, especially a wound or a part of the body
to clean/wash/rinse/cleanse/bathe sth in/with sth
to clean/wash/rinse sth from sth
to clean/wash/cleanse/bathe a wound
to clean/wash/rinse (down) the car
to clean/wash/rinse the floor
to wash/rinse your hair
to have sth cleaned/washed/dry-cleaned
to wash/rinse sth clean
rinse sth↔out
to make sth clean, especially a container, by washing it with water

data.chText: 使用前将杯子冲洗一下。
data.enText: Rinse the cup out before use.

tr: the act of giving a light tint to the hair
the removal of soap with clean water in the final stage of washing
a liquid preparation used on wet hair to give it a tint
rinse one's mouth and throat with mouthwash
wash off soap or remaining dirt

value.def: When you rinse something, you wash it in clean water in order to remove dirt or soap from it.

example.ex: After shampooing, always rinse the hair several times in clear water...
example.tran: 每次用完洗发剂后都要用清水将头发冲洗几次。

example.ex: It's important to rinse the rice to remove the starch.
example.tran: 一定要淘米以洗掉淀粉。

example.ex: A quick rinse isn't sufficient. Use plenty of running water to wash away all traces of shampoo.
example.tran: 光快速冲洗一下是不够的。得用大量流水把残余的洗发水都洗干净。

value.def: If you rinse your mouth, you wash it by filling your mouth with water or with a liquid that kills germs, then spitting it out.

example.ex: Use a toothbrush on your tongue as well, and rinse your mouth frequently.
example.tran: 舌头也要用牙刷清洁，并且经常漱口。

example.ex: After her meal she invariably rinsed out her mouth...
You should rinse your mouth out after eating.

value.def: A hair rinse is a dye whose colour gradually disappears after you have washed your hair a number of times, rather than being permanent.
